title: Pitcher, ca. 1879
markings: Marks: Impressed on underside of base: "WEDGWOOD / 24 / M N N H G [?]." Painted in green overglaze on underside of base: "3 / M2762." Applied registry mark lozenge for 1879 on underside.
creditline: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Norton Spritz
description: Ovoid jug, tapered inward toward circular foot and toward lip. Body moldedwith pattern of upright Japanese fans, joined at lip, and alternating with prunus branches and birds. Ground is white, fans green-brown, with poly- chrome flowers and birds. Molded applied handle in the form of a branch. Interior glazed turquoise. Underside of base glazed white.

tombstone.epitaph:
Pitcher, ca. 1879.
ca. 1879. earthenware, glaze. Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Norton Spritz. 1991-152-2.
